Now, the C program structure:

#include <stdio.h>
#include <string.h>

int main() {
    // Step 1: Read input for first program
    int n, x;
    scanf("%d %d", &n, &x);
    int a[n];
    for (int i=0; i<n; i++) scanf("%d", &a[i]);

    // Compute first step's result (m)
    int b[n][n];
    for (int i=0; i<n; i++) {
        int m = a[i];
        for (int j=0; j<n; j++) {
            int k = i - j;
            if (k <0) k +=n;
            if (a[k] < m) m = a[k];
            b[j][i] = m;
        }
    }
    long long min_val = 1e15;
    for (int row =0; row <n; row++) {
        int sum_row =0;
        for (int col=0; col <n; col++) {
            sum_row += b[row][col];
        }
        int current = sum_row + x * row;
        if (current < min_val) {
            min_val = current;
        }
    }

    // Step 2: Process second program
    int second_input = min_val;
    int l =1, r = second_input;
    while (l < r) {
        int mid = l + (r - l)/2;
        int idxcnt = mid*(mid+1)/2;
        if (idxcnt < second_input) {
            l = mid +1;
        } else {
            r = mid;
        }
    }
    l -=1;
    int idxcnt_final = l*(l+1)/2;
    int second_result = second_input - idxcnt_final;

    // Step 3: Process third program
    char str[20];
    sprintf(str, "%d", second_result);
    int len = strlen(str);
    if (len !=4) {
        printf("No");
        return 0;
    }
    int freq[256] = {0};
    for (int i=0; i<4; i++) {
        freq[str[i]]++;
    }
    int distinct =0;
    for (int i=0; i<256; i++) {
        if (freq[i] >0) distinct++;
    }
    if (distinct !=2) {
        printf("No");
        return 0;
    }
    int valid =1;
    for (int i=0; i<256; i++) {
        if (freq[i] !=0 && freq[i] !=2) {
            valid =0;
            break;
        }
    }
    if (valid) {
        printf("Yes");
    } else {
        printf("No");
    }
    return 0;
}
